comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Adolphe Pégoud WWI aviator. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adolphe_Pegoud "French Aviator & World War I Flying Ace - The first military pilot of any nationality to be accorded "ace" status (shooting down at least 5 enemy aircraft). Killed in combat in 1915." His grave at Montparnasse:

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: See earlyaviators.com/epegoud2.htm for more pictures of Pegoud and includes another Bain photo of the same pair: esp.ebay.com/viewItem?item=310176494769&v=gbh (at least for now) shows another view, perhaps a crop of the picture just above, on the front page of a newspaper or magazine, Le Miroir.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: A more permanent source for the Le Miroir cover photo: upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/8/82/M_40_Adolphe_... and another Bain photo of Pegoud
